posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Blackguard Executioner


Image source: https://www.pinterest.com.au/pin/647040671441153837/


This was a very brutally effective build which I playtested solo on WoG, which is a challenging mid magic PvM environment for the soloist.

It features:

Rogue 13 for awesome skills (300+ points), evasion/uncanny dodge/crippling strike, sneak attack (13d6 total), UMD/Tumble 40
Fighter for combat prowess (Base AB 43) and epic weapon specialization
Blackguard for further combat prowess, further sneak attack, further bonus combat feats, an epic vrock, taunt, bonuses to saves, access to divine might.

The basic strategy is to:

- UMD to buff (with stackable bull's strength for +4 to 8 str, flame weapon, keen weapon, prot v evil/mind blank, improved invisibility, stoneskin/premonition etc)
- Summon if you wish
- Expertise/Taunt cheese for up to -6 AC (for more details, see Maximillan Kane's post, as it was his discovery)
- Improved Knockdown
- Then land an enormous amount of damage-> 13d6 sneak attack, +10-16 Str damage, +6 WS/EWS damage, +3-9 divine damage if divine might is used, +4-15 flame weapon damage if this is used
- Crippling strike for 2 str damage per sneak attack hit making them easier to knockdown again
- Devastating critical to potentially kill them if you crit them.

If you cannot knock them down, UMD or your Blackguard Summons can be used to draw aggression for flanking sneak attacks against non-rogues/barbarians/assassins (flanking sneak attacks are difficult against those classes due to Uncanny Dodge 1.74+).

For tough fights you can set deadly traps before battle, although I never needed to do this as I was so powerful.

Once all your opponents were defeated, you had all the rogue skills to deal with remaining problems, such as traps, I used UMD + knock spell to open locks, but if you like you can put points into open lock as a variant. 

Originally I was interested in boosting the AB to the maximum it could get to (Base 45) however I decided to drop this down a little and boost charisma for extra saves + taunt bonus + divine might for divine damage (against those physical damage resistant opponents) and boost the fort save (against petrify/implosion/dev crit, which there is no immunity) to now finalise the build.

The most similar builds are TyrTemplar's The Dark Prince dev crit version and no dev crit version which are excellent builds, they have different class splits.

If you don't want devastating critical or it is disabled in your environment, then drop great cleave, overwhelming critical and devastating critical, for great fortitude, armor skin, and epic fiendish servant / epic toughness / improved sneak attack and take epic prowess as a bonus feat earlier.

I would recommend any single handed martial weapon, scimitar has the largest threat range, and keen weapon can be cast on it, meaning it had frequently critically hit but if one wishes to lower the the dev crit frequency then a lesser threat range weapon can be used.
SpoilerRogue(13), Fighter(8), Blackguard(19), Human STR: 16 (30) CON: 14 INT: 14 01: Rogue(1): Power Attack, Cleave 03: Fighter(2): Blind Fight, Expertise 05: Fighter(4): Weapon Specialization: Scimitar 07: Rogue(2): {Evasion} 09: Blackguard(2): Improved Knockdown, {Smite Good} 11: Blackguard(3) 13: Blackguard(5) 15: Blackguard(7): Toughness 17: Rogue(3): {Uncanny Dodge I} 19: Blackguard(10) 21: Fighter(8): Epic Weapon Focus: Scimitar, Epic Weapon Specialization: Scimitar 23: Blackguard(11) 25: Rogue(6) 27: Rogue(7): Great Strength II, (STR=23) 29: Blackguard(14) 31: Blackguard(16): Devastating Critical: Scimitar 33: Rogue(9): Epic Fortitude 35: Blackguard(17) 37: Rogue(12) 39: Rogue(13): Great Strength V, Slippery Mind, (STR=29) Skillpoints: 311 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +4, Traps: +2 AB (max, naked): 43 (melee), 29 (ranged) Spell Casting:  01: Disable Trap(4), Open Lock(1), Search(4), Set Trap(1), Spot(4), UMD(4), Save(26),  03: Discipline(1), Spellcraft(3), Save(24),  05: Discipline(1), Save(32),  07: Disable Trap(3), Hide(5), Search(3), Set Trap(4), Spot(6), Tumble(10), UMD(6), Save(10),  09: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(5),  11: Discipline(1), Taunt(2), Save(11),  13: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(17),  15: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(23),  17: Disable Trap(7), Spot(10), Tumble(10), UMD(10),  19: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(4),  21: Discipline(1), Save(12),  23: Discipline(2), Taunt(4),  25: Disable Trap(1), Spellcraft(5), Spot(1), UMD(1), Save(1),  27: Disable Trap(2), Spot(2), Tumble(5), UMD(2),  29: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(4),  31: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(10),  33: Disable Trap(1), Search(2), Set Trap(3), Spot(1), Save(4),  35: Discipline(4), Taunt(4),  37: Disable Trap(1), Spellcraft(5), Spot(1), Tumble(5),  39: Disable Trap(8), Search(1), Spot(2), 
I wish to acknowledge the very significant contributions of Empyre65, Valerfor and Mick Dagger with assisting me with optimizing this build.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I wouldn't bother with that 1 level of Assassin because HiPS would be useless with such low stealth skills. 2 more Rogue levels would give you another Rogue feat, or 6 levels of Fighter would give you WS/EWS, but I see that either of those options would cost you 1 or 2 Blackguard feats.  1 level of Fighter would give you another feat, which you could use for earlier Epic Prowess, while using the Blackguard feat for Improved Sneak Attack.  2 fewer CON could give you 4 more DEX, for 2 more AC, even in heavy armor, protected by Uncanny Dodge.  Also, no Crippling Strike?

Edit: Congrats on being the one to post the 1000th thread!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Empyre for your comments.

And congratulations to the ECB on reaching 1000 threads! 

What a remarkable achievement for the ECB, considering NWN 1 is a game which is 17 years old!

Agree completely with Crippling Strike I need to fit it in there instead of ESF: Discipline

Thanks for reminding me about Rogue 19 getting a bonus feat, I completely forgot about that! 

That was a very valuable comment Empyre. 

I could drop 3 blackguard levels and the assassin level for two fighter levels and two rogue levels I think! 

I would lose 2d6 sneak attack and the blackguard bonus feat, but gain two fighter bonus feats, one rogue bonus feat and 1d6 sneak attack. 

I could even take the fighter levels pre-epic for a Rogue 8 / Blackguard 10 / Fighter 2 split to gain 1AB. And divert 8 skill points from move silently and 3 from hide elsewhere

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This build would be an instant like for me, if only for the reason that it uses one of the most underrated classes in NwN, the Blackguard.
I also like the ESF: Taunt, now you have significant chances to succeed even if your opponent has concentration.
Similarly to the "Thug", take CS here as well, then change as Empyre said Ass1 to Ftr1, for earlier EP & use BG22 for ISA, in order to keep the sneaks to 17d6.
Also, steal some ranks from Concentration & put them in Set traps 16 (15), for deadly ones, another tool in the toolbox, won't hurt.
You could even make a non-Dev Crit version of it, the damage is going to be huge in this one, when using Darkness + Ultravision (wands) or just IKD + Taunt +Attack (feat chain).
All in all, good stuff!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like this class combo. I don't think there has been posted any builds with it so far. I am a fan of CS (no, not Counter Strike this time), especially in strength builds where you don't bother with qualifying for Epic Dodge. If you land some CSs, any strength build will crumble.
The one level of assassin deserves it's place for one extra d6 SA if rogue is on an odd level and there are no bonus feats at the next level for the other classes. I like to take the hit on skillpoints and go for assassin 9 for Improved invisibility and less rogue levels.
If you want an extra feat with a single level, ranger is an alternative to fighter in epic levels. You can take EWF or EP, get dual wield, extra skill points etc.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks so much everyone for the suggestions.

I've made a second draft of the build. Rogue 19 / Fighter 2 / Blackguard 19.

It still has 17d6 sneak attack, dev crit, ESF: Taunt, improved knockdown, but also has a ending Str of 34, Base AB 43, crippling strike.

450hp and armor skin combined with improved evasion and tower shield should provide enough defensive capabilities.

Took the fighter levels epic to add more epic feats allowing me to take 7 great strengths.

I put set trap to 15 modified but in environments where One with the land is easily accessible then set trap 11 can work, but I recall most single player modules will have trouble with accessing that spell via scrolls (haven't played a single player module for a while now...)

Dropped Int from 14 to 13 and Cha to 10 to get the Str up. Dropped concentration as a skill, I thought I would get more value from other skills. Still has about 300 skill points which is heaps.

This is my first time making a 'proper Rogue', with rogue as a primary class, so I sincerely appreciate all the feedback I have received, its been a great learning process for me.

SpoilerRogue(19), Fighter(2), Blackguard(19), Human STR: 17 (34) CON: 16 INT: 13 01: Rogue(1): Power Attack, Blind Fight 03: Rogue(3): Cleave, {Uncanny Dodge I} 05: Rogue(5) 07: Rogue(7) 09: Blackguard(1): Weapon Focus (Scimitar) 11: Blackguard(3) 13: Blackguard(5) 15: Blackguard(7): Improved Knockdown 17: Rogue(9) 19: Blackguard(10) 21: Blackguard(11): Great Strength I, (STR=23) 23: Blackguard(12) 25: Blackguard(14) 27: Rogue(12): Great Strength III, (STR=26) 29: Rogue(13): Improved Evasion 31: Fighter(2): Armor Skin 33: Rogue(15): Great Strength V, (STR=30) 35: Blackguard(17) 37: Rogue(18) 39: Rogue(19): Great Strength VII, Improved Sneak Attack I, (STR=33) Skillpoints: 304 Saving Throw bonuses: Traps: +4 AB (max, naked): 43 (melee), 27 (ranged) Spell Casting:  01: Disable Trap(4), Hide(4), Listen(4), Open Lock(4), Search(4), Set Trap(4), UMD(4), Save(12),  03: Disable Trap(1), Listen(1), Open Lock(1), Search(1), Set Trap(1), UMD(1), Save(14),  05: Disable Trap(1), Listen(1), Search(1), Set Trap(1), UMD(1), Save(23),  07: Disable Trap(1), Listen(1), Set Trap(1), Tumble(5), UMD(1), Save(29),  09: Discipline(12), Taunt(12), Save(16),  11: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(20),  13: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(24),  15: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(28),  17: Disable Trap(9), Open Lock(9), Set Trap(3), Tumble(10), UMD(9),  19: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(2),  21: Discipline(2), Taunt(2), Save(3),  23: Discipline(2), Taunt(2),  25: Discipline(1), Taunt(1), Save(4),  27: Disable Trap(1), Open Lock(5), Tumble(5), UMD(5),  29: Disable Trap(6), Open Lock(2), UMD(2),  31: Discipline(1), Save(5),  33: Disable Trap(1), Listen(8), Open Lock(1),  35: Discipline(4), Taunt(7),  37: Disable Trap(1), Listen(2), Tumble(5), Save(2),  39: Disable Trap(2), Listen(8),

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That's a straight-up monster.
And I like the "snake-eyes" on its hit-points.
The only nick in its armor, its saving throws, but you can't have a perfect build & there is access to umd to help that. 

I would personally put that into the 40's section, where it belongs.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Here is an attempt I made at Rogue/ Assassin/ BG a couple of years ago. My aim was a strength based warrior with warrior AB and high SA damage.
I was a bit on the fence about posting it because it can be very hard to level a strength based rogue in only light armor to level 9. I thought it may be of interest here in this thread though.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for posting it Mick

I discovered Str based rogues are rough until that heavy armor/shield proficiency is achieved

I got this guy to level 9 on WoG to get his first blackguard level.

Until I got it, I had an AC of 13 () as he was restricted to light armor and unable to use shields.

As a solo player I had to think outside the box. Ie UMD, use summons, use a wand of missiles etc.

If I was even smarter I would have crafted and used some traps to make it even easier

In modules with parties / companions / henchmen undoubtedly things are much easier, particularly with sneak attack

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:I like this class combo. I don't think there has been posted any builds with it so far.
Well, I was wrong - should have checked better.
There are 4 builds in the old archives with rogue/ BG/assassin. Two of them are dex builds, One is a combined dex and strength build with epic dodge and dev crit, suffering an AB of +34. The fourth build gets str 27. It has focus on taking Improved sneak attack (10) and ends with an AB of +37. So every Rogue/BG/Assassin posted here so far is new and greatly improved.
As for Rogue/Fighter/ BG there are 9 level 40 builds, but only one with two fighter levels, and that one is a charisma based smiter with 28 BG levels.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Actually I am curious, Mick, Valerfor or Gkorjax or others...

if I take a Rogue 19 / Assassin 5 / Blackguard 16 split

Is the darkness spell from assassin undispellable? Similar to how improved invisibility from assassin is undispellable?

If it is, would the 5 levels of assassin be worth it as a result? (instead of a Rogue 23 / Blackguard 16 / Fighter 1 or Rogue 23 / Blackguard 16 / Assassin 1 split)

17d6+ sneak attack is a big deal and I understand one gets an AB bonus if the opponent doesn't have blind fight or ultravision

It's also only one cast per day which is kinda annoying (I reckon it should be 3 casts per day or have increase casts per day with levels)

I'm also finding whenever I try to add assassin to the build, I find it better to add more rogue levels (for the bonus feats) or do a little fighter or ranger cheese for bonus feats

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Here's an alternative split for Rogue / Fighter / Blackguard

Rogue 13 / Fighter 8 / Blackguard 19

I figured if I include fighter into the build, I will want to try to get Epic Weapon Specialisation if I can.

Also I've put the AB up to 45, finally meeting Mithdradates's high standards of a 'good warrior's AB (getting to that number is tough work!). 

That was achieved by doing a Rogue 3 / Fighter 7 / BG 10 split pre-epic.

With Capped AB, Capped Strength, and Taunt, the AB works out to be 45 +20 +6 +6 = 77

The earlier fighter levels makes the game play early on easier. Light armor, no shield and negative dex for a melee build was tough work! The only way I managed it was cheesy UMD stuff.

Sneak attack dropped down to 13d6 but the +6 damage / hit and higher AB I think more than compensates. 

I do like high sneak attack numbers though and it was tempting to use the bonus rogue feats for improved sneak attack instead. 

TyrTemplar has a build with a slightly different split (R10F8B22 - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 55434.html) and goes Divine Might / Shield and has 12d6 sneak attack rather than 13d6. I would also do some tweaks of Tyr's build if I was playing it, for example take rogue at level 1 for a whole pile of extra skill points, maybe get the rogue levels at 7 / 17 pre epic for the tumble dumps ASAP (that +1AC does make a difference).

Anyway, what do you think? Thanks so much for the very helpful comments

Edit: I also squeezed in a 'Resist Energy' feat to keep Agardis happy, that feat needs some love! (It also stacks with equipment). I figured a demonic evil blackguard would definitely be resistant to fire, but acid is a good choice too!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Dear ECB moderator team
I have play-tested this build sufficiently and wish to finalize this build draft for consideration for the level 40 section.
The final build is edited into the first post of this thread.
With many thanks.
